com.communote.server.core.blog.helper

Class BlogRoleHelper

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.communote.server.core.blog.helper.BlogRoleHelper

  • public final class BlogRoleHelper
extends Object
    Helper class for working with blog role constants.
    Author:
    Communote GmbH - http://www.communote.com/

    • Method Detail

      • convertNumericToRole

        public static BlogRole convertNumericToRole(int numericRole)
        Convert a numeric representation of a role into the role object.
        Parameters:
        numericRole - the numeric representation of the role
        Returns:
        the role
        See Also:
        convertRoleToNumeric(BlogRole)

      • convertRoleToNumeric

        public static int convertRoleToNumeric(BlogRole role)
        Convert a role into a numeric representation. The higher the returned value the higher is the access right.
        Parameters:
        role - the role to convert
        Returns:
        the numeric representation of the role

      • getBlogRoles

        public static Map<BlogRole,String> getBlogRoles(Locale locale)
        Gets the localized user group roles. Null value can be used for no role access
        Parameters:
        locale - the locale
        Returns:
        the user group roles

      • getBlogRolesSortedByAccess

        public static List<String> getBlogRolesSortedByAccess()
        Returns:
        the roles sorted by access level (starting with read access)

      • getUpperRole

        public static BlogRole getUpperRole(BlogRole firstRole,
                                    BlogRole secRole)
        Get back the upper role of given roles
        Parameters:
        firstRole - BlogRole
        secRole - BolgRole
        Returns:
        the of the role

      • sufficientAccess

        public static boolean sufficientAccess(BlogRole actualRole,
                                       BlogRole requiredRole)
        Return whether a role represents the same or a higher access right than another role
        Parameters:
        actualRole - the role to evaluate. Can be null. In that case the role is interpreted as no access and thus, false is returned.
        requiredRole - the role representing the access right the other role should fulfill. Can be null. In that case the role is interpreted as no access is required and thus, true is returned.
        Returns:
        true if the actualRole represents an access right that is higher or equal to the required role, otherwise false is returned
